website_summaries.verdict: Provides a deeper stretch than some other models, if you can get used to its somewhat awkward feeling.
pros: Cradles the ankle in a neutral position to passively stretch the plantar fascia and calf
Shell is breathable, lightweight, and low-profile
Straps and buckles ensure splint stays in place
Comes in small, medium, and large
cons: Some find it awkward to wear at night
A handful of customers say it makes their toes go numb

customer_reviews.title: Crossing straps keeps heel from slipping
customer_reviews.text: Going into my third night with this boot. So far so good. Less painful in the morning and I can make it about half way through my work day without a full stretch session. I have advice for those finding that your heal won't stay seated all the way back, simply criss cross the bottom two straps by clicking the second strap where you would normally click the first strap, and vice versa. I thought I might have to return it because my heal would slip around, but the cross straps have worked wonders. Good boot, will update in a month or so.
customer_reviews.author: SaraJane77

customer_reviews.title: It's a little large but keeps my foot flexed much better then the other one
customer_reviews.text: I tried the other splint first that goes on top of your foot and found that it did not keep my foot flexed enough. I returned it and got this one instead. I wear an 8.5-9 women's and bought the medium sized splint. It's a little large but keeps my foot flexed much better then the other one. It's very comfortable too.
customer_reviews.author: Melodi Moon

customer_reviews.title: Ahhh...finally no pain!
customer_reviews.text: I slip these on before bed and my feet instantly can feel the ache at the bottom of my feet just ease up, so comforting! I use one on each foot and they help with my plantar fasciitis, heel pain, and fallen arches. I’ve worn at least one to bed for over a year now and you do get used to it being on. I don’t have such pain in the am taking those first few steps, so nice!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended for Plantar fasciitis. No more pain.
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to this plantar fasciitis brace, I don’t have pain in my heel anymore, especially in the morning. The pain is gone the next morning. I will keep wearing it for maybe a week every night. I’m glad I do not have to take Advil nor see doctor. This brace took care my heel pain overnight. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Viv ww

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: Appears well made and is easy to adjust and take on and off. I don't wear it in bed as it (or any PF type fixture) is awkward. Has helped my PF by wearing it during the day anytime I am sitting for awhile. I just readjust the ankle strap and place a cold pak in heel area when time to ice my heel. No aggravation trying to keep cold pak in place that way. Remember thick or double socks or folded wash cloth between skin and cold pak.
customer_reviews.author: Pictureman

customer_reviews.title: Look for something else.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed to say I bought 2 of these and they didn't work. They are huge, very uncomfortable to sleep in and because of how they are designed they don't keep your heel in place and are completely ineffective. The ProCare Pro Wedge boots are a bit more expensive but they are not as bulky so they are a bit more comfortable and you can run the strap across the top of your ankle so they really do work. Don't waste your money on these. I seriously wonder if the people who gave these good reviews ever tried sleeping in them or thought they were effective. Just disappointed that I tried them so long I can't return them
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Pro's and Con's
customer_reviews.text: I know it's one of the best ones out there for my physical therapist only problem is is that you can't walk in them so if you get up 3-4 times a night to go to the bathroom you have to take it off and put it back on if you try to walk on it your foot my slide out from under you. I have extreme plantar fasciitis and I was really looking forward to wearing these but getting up at night to go to the bathroom I was worried if I break a leg. Hard to fit underablanket
customer_reviews.author: david viviani

customer_reviews.title: Great boot but beware of sizing adjustment limitations
customer_reviews.text: I’m giving this 4 stars instead of 5 because of the limited adjustment that can be made with the 3 horizontal straps. I am an average height/weight male (5’11, 175), shoe size 10.5-11. The horizontal adjustments on this boot are at their max for me insofar as tightening (meaning the straps run very, VERY large). If you are thin/lean this may not fit you very well (will be too loose). I’m really surprised the designers didn’t allow for more adjustments to be made. I’m going to have to modify it myself. I have worn a boot like this (different brand) at night for almost a year. It makes a huge difference.
customer_reviews.author: ComparedToWhat

customer_reviews.title: As a woman, I ordered based upon the size ...
customer_reviews.text: As a woman, I ordered based upon the size chart and truthfully, it is way too big. I am an 8, so on the cusp between small and medium. I should have gone with a small because there is about 1.5" extra space before my toes, making a challenging split more challenging. Alas.
customer_reviews.author: SJA

customer_reviews.title: Too bulky too sleep in
customer_reviews.text: Really big and bulky to try and sleep in, especially under any kind of cover. It runs REALLY big. I wear a women's size 9, am 5'4" 145lbs. I have average size feet and calves. The size chart said medium but it's HUGE. I only can keep it on 1-2 hours then I always wake up and take it off because I can't sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Danelle A. Jelley

customer_reviews.title: Dont do it.
customer_reviews.text: Hate this product. It is impossible to even put on my foot. The buckles on the one side are so unbelievably short (and you cant adjust that side) that I need to be a contortionist to click the straps in. Then, when I finally manage to avoid breaking my back from all the awkward movement to try and click everything together, you need to adjust the straps properly if they're too loose - that part seems semi doable on some of the sections but definitely not all the sections. I do not suggest purchasing this crap product unless you're super flexible and want to look like a pretzel as you're strapping yourself into this torture device.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helped my plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: I waited over a month to comment here so I could tell if it works long-term. It has helped my plantar fasciitis tremendously! I’ve worn it almost every night and some during the day if I was resting and could leave it on awhile. I know plantar fasciitis will probably always come and go, but this boot helps keep it under control! Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Teacher mom

customer_reviews.title: Greatly reduced pain of plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: I suddenly developed plantar fasciitis. I went to physical therapy for a couple of months, and none of the exercises seemed to lessen the pain. I also bought several new pairs of shoes with good arches, which also weren't particularly helpful. When covid hit, I couldn't go to physical therapy any more. In desperation, I ordered this brace. I wore it for about six weeks, every night. My paint level went from about a 5 to a 1. Now, the pain is barely noticeable, as long as I continue stretching every day and wear supportive shoes. This was a life saver.
customer_reviews.author: lonewolf

customer_reviews.title: Solid and secure
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product specifically to relieve my plantar fasciitis. I tried other devices but they proved so flimsy and didn't work. After a week wearing this device my foot already feels better. It keeps my foot so secure that I can wear it during the day - even at work! It keeps my foot secure at night under the covers as well. I know that healing occurs when my foot is able to retain the proper position to allow healing. I am happy to have finally found a boot that does what it's supposed to do! Great product.
customer_reviews.author: David Greenwood

customer_reviews.title: Only buy these, they work!!
customer_reviews.text: I have brought other boots to wear to bed as my PF is so painful but they were uncomfortable and didn’t work. I have had these 6 days and my feet feel great when I wake up in the morning. I also brought the compression shoes and both help a lot. I’m very happy with these because when I wake up and walk I feel no pain.
customer_reviews.author: great

customer_reviews.title: Works but difficult to sleep with
customer_reviews.text: After many other attempts at stretching exercises with little to no effect on my plantar fasciitis, I tried this boot. It took a number of days but my condition is immensely better. The boot however is very uncomfortable to sleep with and caused me to be very tired in the morning. I found myself adjusting the tension or flat out removing the boot during the night so I could get some solid sleep. The boot is well made and sturdy. If you use the boot while watching tv, etc., be aware you must remove it whenever you need to move around as walking with it is definitely not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: P Squared

customer_reviews.title: Bulky and Effective
customer_reviews.text: I went into Urgent Care with an ankle so painful it interfered with my sleep. Ibuprofen helped, but it wasn’t a solution. The doc suggested that it could be arthritis (I have osteoarthritis in both hips, yay) and gave me a lace up splint thing. That helped a lot until it didn’t. :( I needed something stiffer and less forgiving during the night. I bought this. It’s helped. It’s bulky at night, but eh, small thing compared to an ankle that hurts deep in the joint. However, if the ankle pain doesn’t fully clear up in another week (it’s already been at least 6 weeks), I’m going back in and insisting on a cat scan or x-ray.
customer_reviews.author: javamonster

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work and caused more discomfort.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work well at all. I might as well not have worn it. I couldn't seem to keep my heel back far enough to the proper position to alleviate cramping. The strap across the top of my foot caused major discomfort throughout the night, waking me up, and causing me to readjust the strap only to have it not be tight enough to keep my foot in proper position. I have found that wearing the daytime compression socks actually work well enough at night to stop using this boot. I regret buying it.
customer_reviews.author: ShayM08

customer_reviews.title: Just did not work for me.
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'3" tall, 245lbs and 69 YOA. This splint just would not fit correctly. To me, it was very difficult to adjust and never helped. I tried another brand also, and that was about as bad. I'm a bit lost on what to use when my PF flares up.
customer_reviews.author: Woodshop Man

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd one. The 1st lasted many years of wear. I’ve had a few different types. This one has so many different adjustments, once you get it right for you, it’s easy and truly truly helps my plantar fasciitis. I have found to not pull the top 2 side straps too tight or your heel has a hard time sitting down comfortably in the heel cup part. Just keep adjusting until it feels good. Takes a while to get used to sleeping in it. But I won’t be without one again. I do think it runs a little big. I am a size 8 and I ordered a medium. I think I could of used a size small.
customer_reviews.author: Pam and Newell

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't last one night
customer_reviews.text: I read all the positive reviews on this product and ordered it immediately. I was greatly disappointed. Took me 25 minutes to properly have it fit on my foot. One of the snaps kept undoing, based on poor quality of plastic. After I finally adjusted everything, I got into bed and wore it for 3 hrs. The thick back plastic support was digging into my shin so bad, I had to get out of bed and re-adjusted. Tried it again, but to no avail it was creating pain in the back of my shin. Had to take it off and need to send back.
customer_reviews.author: Vulcan Nomad

customer_reviews.title: This works
customer_reviews.text: I've suffered from plantar faciitis for over three years and I've tried all kinds of heel pads and shoe inserts. I used this splint for two weeks and it reduced and then eliminated my heel pain. Finally, I can take a step in the morning without shooting pain in my heel! I'm very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amy B.

customer_reviews.title: Love/Hate
customer_reviews.text: I have mixed feelings on this product. Does it work? Yes. But it is very uncomfortable. I guess it really was designed more for function than comfort. If you can climb into bed, and have someone else put them on, it's a lot easier. Forget about trying to get up to the bathroom during the night. If you sleep in 1 position all night, this might work for you. But I'm one who flips 3874832 times a night and I felt confined, restricted, hot, and could not sleep with these on.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Was Looking For!
customer_reviews.text: I have plantar fasciitis and was told to get a sleep splint by my doctor. I'm not going to lie and say that this is super comfortable or anything like that. It is a pain in butt. But it is easy to use, works exactly as it is supposed to, and my pain has decreased since getting it. If you can stay in the habit of using it, it is well worth the purchase. It takes some getting used to for sure, but the lack of pain is well worth it in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Trey

customer_reviews.title: Essential part of a Plantar Fasciitis cure
customer_reviews.text: The night splint is the ONLY way to get the Plantar Fascitis to really go away. This one is easy to use, works well, and with the non-skid pad on the bottom, means you can get up at night if necessary without removing the splint.
customer_reviews.author: JustJean

customer_reviews.title: The size is very misleading!!
customer_reviews.text: Just know if you order one of these for planter fasciitis that you have to pay $5.99 to ship it back! The size they advertise is bigger than the actual size!
customer_reviews.author: HA

customer_reviews.title: This brace works
customer_reviews.text: Plantar Fascitis is a bitch for some, me especially. You've done ur research, you've tried different things, some work some not so much.... For me - this brace works and works well. I've had P F for several yrs. I am a very active 60 y/o dude with a high drive - high energy K9. I have to be on my feet a lot. This won't cure P F, but it'll help u get out of bed with less pain.... Yes, it's awkward to sleep with at first. Suck it up and, IMO, it will help.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Pusey

customer_reviews.title: It really helps
customer_reviews.text: After weeks of pain this boot really made the difference for my plantar fasciitis. I wore it while reading in bed or just sitting around for a couple hours a day. Because of the pain it can be quite difficult to put on at first but doesn’t hurt to wear. It’s more comfortable than it looks, the only improvement would be easier to do the straps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: After 5 different dorsal braces I finally went with this one and it is AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: After 5 different dorsal braces I finally went with this one and it is AMAZING! It keeps my foot flexed all night even while turning and it does not cut off the circulation at all. it has 3 easy clips to get in and out of so im not waking up my husband every morning with annoying velcro. THANK YOU so much for making this product! 10/10 would recommend to anyone with plantar facitis or a heel spur.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the one you need for plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: This was the fix! I have tried several options for months at a time and none did the trick. This was the one! One night and I woke up with considerably less pain. After a few nights I was definitly on the mend and could walk pain-free again. This really worked!
customer_reviews.author: Brittian household

customer_reviews.title: Clunky
customer_reviews.text: This is so big and uncomfortable-really difficult to sleep in. Plus a rough edge from somewhere actually tore a hole in my not inexpensive Macy’s hotel sheet! It didn’t happen anymore after I taped every possible rough spot including Velcro ends with duct tape, but really? It does make my plantar fasciitis feel somewhat better, so there’s that, but it’s not worth it. I wear a size 8 shoe so I went with a medium, but it is way big. Think I could’ve gone with a small. Just so big and clunky.
customer_reviews.author: janeo

customer_reviews.title: Helps a lot with tendinitis
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as recommended by my PT. This in conjunction with strength training and stretching has definitely helped a lot with the tendinitis. The things I don't love about it are that I cannot seem to get the straps set such that it isn't either too tight or too loose and it is either cutting off my circulation or too loose to be helping but maybe that is me not the product. Seems to help if you wear a sock with it. I also don't love that the velcro snags on the bed coverings. Overall though it does the job and is a solid choice at the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: fits small
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this to work, but the large is way to small of a fit for a size 14 men's shoe. Seems to be built well but padding seems to be limited compared to other supports. I will be ordering a larger one from another supplier. I would call this a size 10 tops.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Works.
customer_reviews.text: The splint does exactly what it should do, at night, while sleeping. The straps work fine and keep my for in place. That being said, it is something to get used to, while sleeping. If you do not toss and turn, this is great. I toss and turn. I would awaken slightly when I'd shift, to readjust the foot position. I used it for 2 weeks, as I strengthened the muscles supporting my Achilles and ankle after a sprain. The ankle itself is fine, thanks to the splint and therapy. I do recommend this product vs. spending almost 3x's the price for doctor recommended brace that does the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Mj L

customer_reviews.title: Much better than wimpier plantar sleeping braces
customer_reviews.text: I've used the front of the ankle and instep kind of sleeping brace, and they are okay, but this behind the ankle and under the foot is FAR better. Keeps the foot flexed and immobile all night long. Added bonus is the padded and slip resistant sole for hitting the bathroom in the middle of the night.
customer_reviews.author: Bart Hugens

customer_reviews.title: So uncomfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had to wear a night boot for the last couple years due to plantar fasciitis and this one is so uncomfortable. The old one I had is perfect that I got for my doctor but is falling apart. It looked well made when I first opened it but even after trying out for a week the cushion was already imprinted. This one is angled too far in making it unbearable to wear through the night. I’ve tried loosing the attachments but then my foot is falling out. Wake up half way through the night with my foot numb!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth M Taillie

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: This thing definitely helps to minimize, even eliminate, my plantar fasciitis pain in the mornings. The plastic is light and the foam lining makes the item as comfortable as possible. Be aware that the position the brace holds your foot in can get pretty uncomfortable and if you bump your other ankle in the night with this bulky thing, it doesn't exactly feel good. But those issues really cannot be helped, so I do not fault the manufacturer for them.
customer_reviews.author: nichor13

customer_reviews.title: Not a good fit
customer_reviews.text: I think this splint was made for men. I had to struggle to make it snug. First I bought the medium because I wear a size 8 1/2 shoe but it was too big, so I got a small and still the tabs were so big I had to really pull it tight. A weaker person would have a really hard time. There should be splints made for women too.
customer_reviews.author: Betty J Paige

customer_reviews.title: This one works.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had plantar fasciitis for months. Tried everything. Thought I’d give one of these boots a try. This one works. Others don’t. Yes, it’s a bit bulky in bed, but I’ve tried the other more sleek ones and they don’t hold you foot. This one does. Buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Burnvoth

customer_reviews.title: Night splint for plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this splint after recommendation and approval of this particular one by my podiatrist to help with foot pain from plantar fasciitis. Product arrived quickly and was packaged appropriately. I wear a size 10 women’s shoe and the medium size fits appropriately. I have done a little light walking in it but it’s definitely made for wearing while you sleep. The padding between your foot and the splint is mostly comfortable. The straps all include padding on them as well to aid in comfort.
customer_reviews.author: S. Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Slight design flaw
customer_reviews.text: I liked the design, but the placement of the foot straps didn't work for me. I loved that I could get my ankle below 90 deg (85 deg and less), but the straps over the ankle cut off my circulation, plus it leaves the top of the foot free to wiggle left & right (willy nilly). As a result, it didn't keep my foot and ankle secure during sleep. I wished theyd move the foot strap closer to the ball of the foot keeping the foot strapped down and in place. Also keep in mind, if you use this during sleep, your going to have cold hard plastic clips brushing against your opposite foot and leg.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Nice boot, but size down
customer_reviews.text: I love this boot and it works so much better than the other one I own. I would buy a size smaller than they suggest. I bought a medium and I wear a women’s 8 shoe. I have some of the straps on the shortest setting and they won’t get any tighter. Comfortable enough product
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Smith

customer_reviews.title: It does help a little bit.
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to put in & take it out as well, I found it a little uncomfortable to sleep on it but it does help with my pain for the plantar fasciitis however is not what I was looking for, I need something with more strength to stretch my foot without feeling my toes getting numb. I have ordered a foot massager along with the boot so hopefully with both items combine I’ll be able to relieve some of the pain caused by the plantar fasciitis.
customer_reviews.author: Cecigarcia80

customer_reviews.title: This brace works wonders!
customer_reviews.text: I tried to heal plantar fasciitis for a few weeks before caving in and ordering this brace to wear at night. It is amazing how much it helps speed up recovery!! My foot is much better each day. I wish I would've started wearing it when first diagnosed but didn't want to if it wasn't necessary. It's not really uncomfortable either. I sleep fine and feel better having my foot supported in a positive healing position all night.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff & Pam Terrell

customer_reviews.title: fit is poor
customer_reviews.text: I sent the medium back as my foot hung over the end 10.5 - 11 shoe. The large fit my foot but was a little lose everywhere else. Still I use this for quick in the home trips to the bathroom. Easy on and off and has non skid on bottom great for the tile floors. Good support, comfortable, but as I said a little sloppy as too large for my leg but I'm 5' 10" and 160 lbs. A heavier person may need the extra leg room.
customer_reviews.author: G. Haring

customer_reviews.title: My foot just lifts out
customer_reviews.text: My foot won’t stay in the device, it’s like it just slips out. My heal will not stay down unless I’m constantly pressing it back in place with my hands. It also hurts my ankle and the bone on the top of my foot. I hoped it would help because this is my second set of splints this week and this one is worse than the first one (which only hurt the bone on the top of my foot. This one is just not stable enough to help my feet at all.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Walker

customer_reviews.title: Fixed my problem
customer_reviews.text: Once in a while the top of my foot will hurt because I've been standing on my feet for a long time and I need to replace my shoes. I got the brace to alleviate this problem - and it did. My only complaint is that it can be difficult to get on and off and set properly by your self. It's also difficult to get it tied down so your foot doesn't slide around a bit. But it does work well for me. It kept my foot in place and stopped the pain.
customer_reviews.author: Lance B.

customer_reviews.title: Helps relieve foot pain caused by Plantars.
customer_reviews.text: My friend told me this was the best brace he tried for his planters so I ordered it. It works well to relieve the tension and ease the residual pain. The only cons is that the straps are a little thin and flimsy so it has a tendency to shift around on my foot a lot. It's also uncomfortable to wear to bed so it's best to wear it while watching TV or sitting for any length of time. It does help though so I'd recommend buying it if you suffer from this condition.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Great aid in recovery
customer_reviews.text: My son was diagnosed with chronic Achilles tendinitis, and his doctor suggested these to be used between physical therapy sessions. They were hundreds of dollars on other sites, and we just couldn't afford it. These have been a great help to my son, for way less. Very happy with this product
customer_reviews.author: natasha ormsby

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a bad splint. Large too big medium too small. It falls off and slants to the sides. It doesn’t support my tendon. I would not buy this at all. Hard to sleep in and doesn’t do what it states online!
customer_reviews.author: browne

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: This hasn't gotten rid of my plantar fasciitis, but when I get up in the morning, my foot doesn't hurt. Of course it's a little bulky, but worth having a pain free awakening. I wear an 8-1/2 shoe and purchased the medium. I may have been able to get a small, as this sticks out at least an inch beyond my toes. The velcro straps make it easy to adjust for firm, but not snug fit.
customer_reviews.author: Zafira Daima

customer_reviews.title: Much better than soft splint for me
customer_reviews.text: I tried the soft splints and found them lacking support. This is light weight but very supportive. It also protects my heel when turning in bed from any pressure or sheering. Comfortable enough to have on at my desk as a cue to keep my ft flat. What i dont like is the toe width. Im a side sleeper and when my ft shifts to the side i experienced a pressure point. I took padding from soft splint and fixed the problem. I will also say my heel is greatly improved
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Splint for Plantar Fascitis
customer_reviews.text: I bought this brace for my right foot on the advice from my podiatrist. I was training for a 5K and was running on my treadmill almost every day for 3 months. All of a sudden I was experiencing major discomfort in my foot so I saw my doctor who recommended this exact brace. I wear it at night for 15 minutes and then again for 15 minutes in the morning. It really does help with the pain and discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Hockaday

customer_reviews.title: Doc Recommended
customer_reviews.text: This is cumbersome to put on and cumbersome so wear. Once I am asleep I barely notice it. It does make a difference though and my foot is so much better in the morning if I wear it. The doctor recommended this boot specifically. Since my insurance wouldn’t cover it I bought it here. For the left foot it’s a little difficult to latch, the right foot really hard.
customer_reviews.author: Beez

customer_reviews.title: Finally ...sturdy and EASY TO USE
customer_reviews.text: This is doing the healing job for my painful plantar fasciitis. This splint is sturdy and easy to use. Well-designed and comfortable. I was surprised with the comfort in my heel when i unstrapped my foot and took my first. step the next morning. Thank you. Your foot does need to be aat a 90 degree angle from your leg when you sleep to heal. Point blank!
customer_reviews.author: purchased

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat Hard To Adjust
customer_reviews.text: It does keep my foot in position at night, but I had to remove it halfway through the first night because I couldn’t get the straps adjusted to be both secure and comfortable. It’s more a personal health issue than a defect with the actual product. I would prefer to use it in the daytime while watching TV or working. Nighttime is just not comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: E. H. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, much better than what my podiatrist provided
customer_reviews.text: I love this boot. Years back I got two night splints from a podiatrist that were nothing short of awful. They fit poorly and the outer shell was very slick on the bottom making even a few steps to the restroom a perilous adventure. And they were over $200 each! I bought this splint online and compared to my doctor-provided ones, it is so much better. The straps are comfortable, the lining that touches your skin feels great, the bottom is non-slip and the back plastic has holes cut out so your skin can breathe. And the price can't be beat. I love this splint and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Steps to a cure...
customer_reviews.text: I was given a similar one by a friend. I suffer from plantars fasciitis my first one was used so much I wore it out. I bought this one as a replacement. I can’t sleep without it now! Here’s a tip that basically cured my foot trouble. Wear this at night, and in the morning, wake up ten minutes early and before you stand up, wrap your foot in a heating pad. I was told to do this after suffering for a year and a half, and my foot was basically better after a week!! It’s a routine I will now do forever because I never want to suffer from foot pain again!!
customer_reviews.author: beth hendricks

customer_reviews.title: It really works
customer_reviews.text: I have a tendency of wearing cute shoes that provide zero to no support. With that being said, the heel of my feet and bottom of my feet tend to be sore or hurt when I stand in one spot too long. Since I began using this at night, the less pain I feel in the morning. It is very uncomfortable to sleep with but having a sore foot is even more uncomfortable. Definitely worth the purchase and price and I recommend to all I encounter with the same issues. I’ve had this since August.
customer_reviews.author: Jayce

customer_reviews.title: Good for plantar facitis Heel Spur
customer_reviews.text: Real person giving review. Medical supply company here on Long Island wanted triple the price Amazon g8 deal I have plantar facitis heel spur in right foot works good thanks for reading review
customer_reviews.author: naomi groont

customer_reviews.title: EASY TO PUT ON AND TAKE OFF
customer_reviews.text: I'm still testing this product as I have only had it a few days. The instructions said, "DON'T WALK WITH THIS PRODUCT UNLESS ALLOWED BY YOUR DOCTOR"! I am walking with it because I am using it for DROP FOOT. I need to keep it on all day and walk with it in the HOUSE ONLY. So far it has not broken like the other product I ordered. The other products didn't have the BACK support that this one does. I'm hoping it won't break under pressure. Will keep everyone posted.
customer_reviews.author: George Garcia

customer_reviews.title: working good so far, at least a relief!
customer_reviews.text: it's my early review but so far this is the help I needed. I wear it in the evening while watching TV, etc. I havent tried it while sleeping and expect that to be a challenge, but the main point is it fits good ( I have size 12 shoe, 3x wide foot with very high arch.) so far it's nice to have something helping at this price point. my podiatrist wanted $200 for "a cast".
customer_reviews.author: sesvashon

customer_reviews.title: Painful and uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: You have to build up to be able to wear this brace for a long periods of time. I've had for almost 2 months now, and still can't wear it for more than 2-3 hours at a time. I definitely can't leave it on overnight. It provides decent support, and you can adjust the straps to your liking. If you're into torture, you'll like this.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Carmichael

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I recently developed plantar fasciitis and this definitely helps. I wear it at night, not all night, and I can feel the difference in the morning. I have men's size 10.5 shoe, but after reading other comments I ordered the medium, as opposed to the chart advising a large. The medium fit perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence J. Burns

customer_reviews.title: Too clumsy to wear to bed, uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I finally got it on (not easy), found it too large, stiff, uncomfortable for a "bed" splint. Instructions are not to walk on it, which limits its usefulness. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: remazz

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: My foot size is an 8.5 and the medium is a good fit all around, but my heel doesn't stay back against the brace. Im constantly adjusting to try to get it to stay where it should be, but that means that I can't adjust the angle of the brace. After about 10 minutes I get frustrated and take it off.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: You won’t regret this purchase!!
customer_reviews.text: For the first time I awoke pain free! The splint is a quality construction and comfort. The package arrived in a timely fashion. I’m very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Phyl

customer_reviews.title: Treats planar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one size too large, based on the site recommendations. It's uncomfortable to use at night, but helps the PF overall. I've noticed definite improvement - it keeps the tendons stretched out so they don't draw up and cause pain.
customer_reviews.author: C. White

customer_reviews.title: Painful to wear
customer_reviews.text: I have this 3-4 days. Last night wore 30 minutes had to take off. Causing point sin tors and ball of foot. Tonight 45 minutes same thing. I wear 8 so got medium, maybe small be better. I don’t need something to cause more pain I already have...
customer_reviews.author: Keri M.

customer_reviews.title: Runs large
customer_reviews.text: I wear a shoe size 8 (women’s), so I ordered the medium. The first night, it really did seem to help! After that, every night, my foot comes out of it while I sleep. Even though I have super fat legs, I have the Velcro straps as small as they’ll go! If you are borderline, I’d get the smaller size.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: If you can handle the bulk, this one is for you
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this brace because it’s too bulky for me (petite female). I bought the small one for a size 7 female foot size and the brace was big. I tried to put it on and lay down but there was no way I could sleep with it on. The support was good but the bulk was too much to be useful. I returned it with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Aparna Bapu

customer_reviews.title: Helping my Achilles Tendinitis pain.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been wearing this brace to bed for the past two weeks for my Achilles tendinitis. It’s bulky and difficult to maneuver under the covers, but after a few nights it’s not so bad. This really helps to keep the tendon stretched enough so that the pain has noticeably been reduced after a few nights of use. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Wine Lawyer

customer_reviews.title: These are great
customer_reviews.text: These night splints are awesome. It has really helped my plantar fasciitis. Im not completely healed yet but these night splints along with icing, and calve stresses, and using a fresh Aloe Vera and turmeric mixture for pain as well as mustard seed oil and camphor for the pain in the heal at night has really helped with the healing process and has taking the majority of the pain away.
customer_reviews.author: sheryl montoya

customer_reviews.title: Best Plantar Facitis boot
customer_reviews.text: I have tried two different Plantar Facitis socks and a partial splinted boot with no luck. They all hurt my feet after an hour or so. This boot works great and I can wear it all night long. It helps to relieve pain and I notice a huge increase in pain when I do not wear it.
customer_reviews.author: Relte Schutte

customer_reviews.title: Better than the other splint I bought
customer_reviews.text: The plastic buckles attached to the Velcro adjustments make this so much better than the other night splint I bought. Originally I bought a similar splint and the adjustments were all Velcro which only lasted about three weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what everyone is raving about. Yet another highly reviewed waste of money. In order to get any stretch you have to pull it tight. Which makes numbness unavoidable. Not to mention that the heel doesn’t stay put, which defeats the whole purpose. Why do you people do this??? Ugh!
customer_reviews.author: saiesha monique moon

customer_reviews.title: well made
customer_reviews.text: This product didn't work for me as it might for others. I got severe discomfort and leg cramps from the position the boot kept my foot. I tried all sorts of adjustments for several nights but just couldn't bear to wear through the night as it kept me awake in discomfort. This may be just me so I didn't want to be to harsh with the star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Shan C

customer_reviews.title: Not the one for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought this since it was similar to the one my podiatrist gave me. This one was easy to slide out of, which I often did because if was very uncomfortable It’s not a terrible product, but I prefer the more open brace with the top strap to adjust tension.
customer_reviews.author: Bluejay

customer_reviews.title: It really helps
customer_reviews.text: I have a tendon and ligament issue with my left foot. The Dr. recommends for me to use a medical boot during the day. That is difficult to do for a month or so at a time. So I decided to try this to see if it helped me keep my foot in a relaxed but normal position during the night. It does! Yes it takes time to get used to wearing it while you sleep but this helped with the pain as of the first night of use.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Good boot if crossover the straps
customer_reviews.text: As a runner and triathlete, I run into issues with my Achilles about every twelve months. I’ve tried some other cheaper braces but the could never hold the flexed foot. This one does a much better job. Between the brace and self-administered ASTYM treatments, My Achilles is recovering faster, and a lot less day to day pain. I want to reiterate a tip from another review if you feel your heel slipping in the boot. Crossover the foot and ankle straps so ankles straps goes to foot buckle and foot strap goes to the ankles buckle. This will help hold your heel tight in the boot. This boot is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew J. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: My doctor recommended this for my plantar faciiatis but it could never be properly adjusted to keep my foot flat, even with his help. I definitely do not recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Susan O'Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: The first time I tried it, it felt ok but then it started to hurt no matter how I adjusted it. I wore it to sleep but was a pain when I had to get up in the middle of the night to pee. Also I was huffin and puffin getting the things on and off. :/
customer_reviews.author: Sally Hassan

customer_reviews.title: Could not sleep in this
customer_reviews.text: After struggling with plantar fasciitis for a few months, my doctor made me try this boot. It was so uncomfortable, I couldn’t sleep while wearing it. I stopped using it and found that Oofos slides really helped -my feet feel much better now.
customer_reviews.author: M. Torrence

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: I regret regret waiting so long to try this. I'm on my feet everyday and sometimes by the end of the day I can barely walk. I'll wear this a few nights and get quite a bit of relief for days. For me it works. May take a little adjusting to get just right for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Crossing My Fingers & Toes!
customer_reviews.text: I received my product this evening and was surprised at how well it fit! I ordered a size small and my foot fit perfectly. The instructions are easy to understand and I was wearing the split within' seconds! I immediately noticed the stability and stretch when when I put the product on. I suffer from severe plantar fasciitis and a heel spur, some days I can hardly stand. I'm crossing my fingers and toes this helps!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had achilles tendonitis... this brace looks bulky but it is so comfortable and kept my foot at the angle my doctor ordered. Worked like a charm. Cannot praise this brace enough. So easy to adjust the straps. Easy click on/off. Wow! Well designed for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Family Shopper

customer_reviews.title: wasted my money
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these, wasted my money. Very uncomfortable, my feet got numb after about 30 minutes of wearing them. Tried adjusting them different times but if they are loose they turn to the sides. Useless, and the hazard to return them was not worth. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Size small great fit women's shoe size 8 med
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size. Very comfortable. Can adjust tightness. Good quality. Can even walk around to grab a quick something out of the kitchen. Not comfortable enough to sleep in, but great when watching tv or working at my desk (work from home) Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Angie Baby

customer_reviews.title: Morning Pain Gone
customer_reviews.text: It took several adjustments and one night of ripping it off while I was asleep, but once I got it in the right position, everything was golden. It has helped my foot pain tremendously. I could barely walk in the mornings and a lot of times during the day when I was sitting for long periods and now I get right up without any pain. Amazing results.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: i was desperate for something to help my feet heal from plantar fasciitis. this boot and compression sleeves have been life savers. I can only wear the boot for 30 minutes or so before my foot hurts to much from the stretch. but over about a week, I am able to wear it longer. it comes with a wedge that goes under your toes to deepen the stretch, and you can remove that which i did in the beginning. overall excellent product, and arrived quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Liberty

customer_reviews.title: Good product, just not for me
customer_reviews.text: I tried to sleep in this splint to help relieve plantar fasciitis pain and swelling. Every single time I tried to wear it I would end up ripping it off in the middle of the night. I also have small feet (5.5 women’s) and it slid around a bit causing me to tighten the straps more. It was uncomfortable for me so I need to find something different, but I’m sure this would typically work fine for others with more average feet. My coworkers daughter uses it on both feet and it’s worked miracles for her.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Pain free
customer_reviews.text: I suffer with planter fasciitis and my podiatrist recommended this boot. This product is amazing. It is very comfortable and lightweight. I wear it at night, and ever since I tried it I have not had any pain. If you suffer with the same problem as I do, I highly recommend you purchase this boot.
customer_reviews.author: CKB in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Good for drop foot
customer_reviews.text: I suffer from partial drop foot on one side. I use this splint at night too keep the heel and calf muscles from tightening too much and shortening up on me. Very comfortable brace. Easy to buckle. Better than others I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndie A-VA

customer_reviews.title: Helps my heel heal.
customer_reviews.text: Helpful, adjustable, but can't quite get my heel to rest on the bottom...but for the price, it works to keep my foot almost flexed. The plantar fasciitis which is most painful just out of bed, hasn't healed completely after nearly a month of wear, but it helps get me moving. Glad I brought it.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie W

customer_reviews.title: Bulky and uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Dr. said to get a hard brace. I ordered a medium but it's way bigger than expected. For a nighttime or resting (not walking) boot it is uncomfortable especially if you wear it to bed. Too hard, large buckles. It does hold the foot, though, as it is supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: jc

customer_reviews.title: Stable with great stretching options
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my plantar fasciitis and it seems to be helping. It has 4 different adjustable velcro straps to give you many options for angles and stability. It also comes with a wedge you can put under your toes for added stretch. Start slow! My first inclination was to put it at a steep angle so I really felt a stretch from the beginning but this caused numbness after awhile and then I took the whole thing off in the middle of the night, instead of simply readjusting it.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect. My doctors office wanted $400 for something similar... I purchased this instead & I’m glad I did!!!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Good product,  but a few challenges
customer_reviews.text: If you are challenged bending you will find this difficult to get on. You will want to wear a sock with this as it will make your foot hot and sweaty. It hit so bad I had to take it off 2 hours into the first night wearing it.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality! I had just spent twice as much for another one from my doctors office. I found this one online and it is just as good as the one I spent more for. I needed one for each foot. Pain is going away.
customer_reviews.author: DSherwood

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable !
customer_reviews.text: This product did not work out for me because, it was very uncomfortable , and not steady. My podiatrist had recommended me to get this., but once I told him I could tolerate it , I returned the item.
customer_reviews.author: Lexy

product_meta.title: Alpha Medical Plantar Fascitis Night Splint Heel & Foot Pain; P.F. Brace L4398 (Medium)
feature_bullets: ~ Provides gentle stretch to the plantar fascia and Achilles tendon
~ Helps alleviate night time foot and heel pain
~ Lightweight, low profile shell is sturdy and breathable
~ Three padded straps with buckles to ensure immobilization
~ Soft foam interior is brethable to eliminate heat buildup

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
